content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/xsl/oairepository/oai2.xsl.v1.0" ?> <OAI-PMH xmlns="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/OAI-PMH.xsd"> <responseDate>2015-03-15T22:54:08Z</responseDate><request verb="ListRecords" set="user-innovatika" metadataPrefix="oai_dc">http://zenodo.org/oai2d</request><ListRecords> <record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:10134</identifier><datestamp>2014-05-26T07:28:32Z</datestamp><setSpec>openaire</setSpec><setSpec>user-innovatika</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd">   <dc:creator>Osipyants Pavel Maksimovich</dc:creator>   <dc:title>REDUCTION OF DIMENSION IN LINEAR BINARY CLASSIFICATION</dc:title>   <dc:date>2014-05-01</dc:date>   <dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject>   <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/10134</dc:identifier>   <dc:identifier>           doi:10.5281/zenodo.10134</dc:identifier>   <dc:description><p>Consider the linear problem of binary classification (if the problem is linearly inseparable, it can be led to that by using a symmetric integral L-2 kernel). In solving this problem the classified elements are represented as elements of a vector space of dimension n. In practice n can be extremely large, for example for the task of classification of genes, it can reach tens of thousands. Large dimension implies high computation time and potentially high calculation error. Moreover, the use of large dimension can be expensive (for experimentation). So the question is: how to reduce n by discarding insignificant element components so that the elements were separated &quot;no worse&quot; in new space (were linearly separable) or &quot;not much worse.&quot;</p>  <p>In this article I want to start with a brief overview of the technique from the article Isabel Guyon, Jason Weston, Stephen Barnhill, Vladimir Vapkin &quot;Gene Selection for Cancer Classification using&quot; and then offer my own method.</p></dc:description>   <dc:rights>         info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess       </dc:rights>   <dc:type>       info:eu-repo/semantics/article     </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> </metadata></record><record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:10135</identifier><datestamp>2014-05-26T07:38:27Z</datestamp><setSpec>user-innovatika</setSpec><setSpec>openaire</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd">   <dc:creator>Kulikov Andrey Nikolaevich</dc:creator>   <dc:title>OPTIMIZATION PROGRAM BASED ON  SCHOOL FISH SEARCH ALGORITHM</dc:title>   <dc:date>2014-05-01</dc:date>   <dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject>   <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/10135</dc:identifier>   <dc:identifier>           doi:10.5281/zenodo.10135</dc:identifier>   <dc:description><p>The main purpose of the &laquo;optimization program based on school fish search algorithm&raquo; is to provide faster and more efficient finding local extrema of a function of several real variables than standard iterative methods due to the algorithm that simulates behavior of a school of fish in the wild foraging.&nbsp;</p></dc:description>   <dc:rights>         info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess       </dc:rights>   <dc:type>       info:eu-repo/semantics/article     </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> </metadata></record><record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:10136</identifier><datestamp>2014-05-26T09:57:02Z</datestamp><setSpec>openaire</setSpec><setSpec>user-innovatika</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd">   <dc:creator>Yakubovsky Dmitry</dc:creator>   <dc:creator>Bormontov Evgeny Nikolaevich</dc:creator>   <dc:creator>Klukin Vladimir Ivanovich</dc:creator>   <dc:creator>Turikov Dmitry Aleksandrovich</dc:creator>   <dc:title>OPTIMIZATION OF ANN-TRAINING GEOMETRIC ALGORITHM IN INDEPENDENT COMPONENT ANALYSIS (ICA)</dc:title>   <dc:date>2014-05-01</dc:date>   <dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject>   <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/10136</dc:identifier>   <dc:identifier>           doi:10.5281/zenodo.10136</dc:identifier>   <dc:description><p>One of the most actual tasks of information processing today is the problem of separating a mixture of several sources of signals. Moreover, the solution requires the on-line processing mode. With this task successfully cope artificial neural networks (ANN). But for stable operation of the system, the ANN require training on specific algorithms. This article discusses a modification one of ANN-training geometric algorithms - histGEO.</p></dc:description>   <dc:rights>         info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess       </dc:rights>   <dc:type>       info:eu-repo/semantics/article     </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> </metadata></record><record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:10137</identifier><datestamp>2014-05-26T09:57:02Z</datestamp><setSpec>openaire</setSpec><setSpec>user-innovatika</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd">   <dc:creator>Ushakov Stanislav Andreevich</dc:creator>   <dc:title>USING DISTRIBUTED ARTIFICIAL IMMUNE SYSTEMS  FOR SYMBOLIC REGRESSION</dc:title>   <dc:date>2014-05-01</dc:date>   <dc:subject>cc-zero</dc:subject>   <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/10137</dc:identifier>   <dc:identifier>           doi:10.5281/zenodo.10137</dc:identifier>   <dc:description><p>This article discusses the basic concepts of artificial immune system. I argue that AIS can be used for solving Symbolic regression problem. Also the algorithm and its realization are presented as well as its parallel version.</p></dc:description>   <dc:rights>         info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess       </dc:rights>   <dc:type>       info:eu-repo/semantics/article     </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> </metadata></record><record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:10138</identifier><datestamp>2014-05-26T09:57:02Z</datestamp><setSpec>openaire</setSpec><setSpec>user-innovatika</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd">   <dc:creator>Shpak Ekaterina Mihailovna</dc:creator>   <dc:title>THE FORMING OF ENTERPRISE STRUCTURES\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd KEY COMPETENCES</dc:title>   <dc:date>2014-05-01</dc:date>   <dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject>   <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/10138</dc:identifier>   <dc:identifier>           doi:10.5281/zenodo.10138</dc:identifier>   <dc:description><p>The concept of the enterprise structure is considered. The approaches to the classification of the company key competences are represented and author gives his own list of building company&rsquo;s business capacities. The role of knowledge as a key strategic asset of the company allowing it to successfully compete in the market was studied</p></dc:description>   <dc:rights>         info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess       </dc:rights>   <dc:type>       info:eu-repo/semantics/article     </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> </metadata></record><record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:10139</identifier><datestamp>2014-05-26T09:57:02Z</datestamp><setSpec>openaire</setSpec><setSpec>user-innovatika</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd">   <dc:creator>Dubov Ilya Roydovich</dc:creator>   <dc:title>EXPERIENCE OF FREEFEM++ AND NETGEN USAGE  IN THE SIMULATION PROGRAM FOR AERODYNAMIC PROCESSES</dc:title>   <dc:date>2014-05-01</dc:date>   <dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject>   <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/10139</dc:identifier>   <dc:identifier>           doi:10.5281/zenodo.10139</dc:identifier>   <dc:description><p>The article describes the experience of using of the open source libraries such as Freefem++ and NetGen to develop a simulation program for aerodynamic processes. Using of these libraries can reduce development time, but it is necessary to solve some technical problems that are described in the article.</p></dc:description>   <dc:rights>         info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess       </dc:rights>   <dc:type>       info:eu-repo/semantics/article     </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> </metadata></record></ListRecords> </OAI-PMH>
